info.title: Auth API
info.description: Authorization and authentication API for EXOsoft products (DCI, VM)

get.summary: Get list of additional role`s names
get.description: It is not so deprecated as experimental. OpenAPI has no property to show this. Basically auth service does not know anything about builtin roles so you have to add them to environment variable BUILTIN_ROLES. For example, it's value could be "@admin,@user".

200.description: You will recieve the list of the roles

get.summary: Get list of custom roles
get.description: That handler is used to get full information about all custom roles

200.description: You wall recieve the list of all existing custom roles

human_descr.example: Such admins could create new users

401.description: Provided token was incorrect or expired

code.description: Error code. It was designed to be unique for each place where an error can occur

post.description: Add a custom role in the system

human_descr.example: Such admins could create new users

task.description: Task id. Most objects are not created immedeatly. In most cases when you recieve result only record in database was created. To finish object creation system will create 'task'. Only when task will be finished object will be ready. You can wait task using its Id or watching for object itself (it is prefered way). For details you should read Notifier documentation

get.summary: Get list of the users
get.description: Returns complete list of the users. To limit it you can use standard filtering and pagination query string syntax

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: List field name. Gets set of unique field values. This parameter used to get values for select input in filtering forms. Filtering, pagination and order parameters will be ignored

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Filtering rules for the list. You can use any list field name and set of logical operations (OR, AND, NOT, EQ(=), NE(<>), GT(>), GE(>=), LT(<), LE(<=) and CP(LIKE)) for making filtering conditions
parameters.example: id GT 100 AND (name CP 'alex%' OR name CP 'georg')

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Sorting rules for the list. You can use any list field name and optional ordering parameter (`ASC` and `DESC`). `ASK` is the default so you needent to specify it

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit row count in result. It consists from one or two parts separeted by ','. First (optional) - offset, sets first row number to return (counting from 1). Second - size, set maximum row count in result

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: You can save your query params `orderby` and `where` or you can use saved one

200.description: You will recieve the list of the users

uuid.description: Unique user Id. It should be used for all external links

email.description: User E-Mail. It is also used as login name

roles.description: User roles for 'src' service

401.description: Provided token was incorrect or expired

code.description: Error code. It was designed to be unique for each place where an error can occur

post.description: Register new user in the system. User will not be able to login before he/her will be granted access to some instance

email.description: User E-Mail will be used as login name

password.description: We save only hash so nobody can read it. But you can restore your password using E-Mail

roles.description: Set of the roles for "src" service

task.description: Task id. Most objects are not created immedeatly. In most cases when you recieve result only record in database was created. To finish object creation system will create 'task'. Only when task will be finished object will be ready. You can wait task using its Id or watching for object itself (it is prefered way). For details you should read Notifier documentation

get.summary: Get list of the instance users
get.description: Returns complete list of the instance users. To limit it you can use standard filtering and pagination query string syntax

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: Existing instance ID. Minimal value - 1.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: List field name. Gets set of unique field values. This parameter used to get values for select input in filtering forms. Filtering, pagination and order parameters will be ignored

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Filtering rules for the list. You can use any list field name and set of logical operations (OR, AND, NOT, EQ(=), NE(<>), GT(>), GE(>=), LT(<), LE(<=) and CP(LIKE)) for making filtering conditions
parameters.example: id GT 100 AND (name CP 'alex%' OR name CP 'georg')

parameters.name: orderby
parameters.description: Sorting rules for the list. You can use any list field name and optional ordering parameter (`ASC` and `DESC`). `ASK` is the default so you needent to specify it

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit row count in result. It consists from one or two parts separeted by ','. First (optional) - offset, sets first row number to return (counting from 1). Second - size, set maximum row count in result

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: You can save your query params `orderby` and `where` or you can use saved one

200.description: You will recieve the list of the instance users

uuid.description: Unique user Id. It should be used for all external links

email.description: User E-Mail. It is also used as login name

get.summary: Get your current roles to single instance services
get.description: That handler is used by proxy to check access to single instance services when request contains token

parameters.name: X-XSRF-Token
parameters.description: Token that was got

owner_id.description: Authorized owner. That value will be used to check access for this session.

trustee_id.description: Authorized user. It contains ID of user was used to login to system. owner_id and trustee_id pair identifies list of current session roles. If owner and trustee is a same user this property can be omitted

roles.description: Current users roles. If it is null - no handle was found (no one role was permitted to call it)

401.description: Provided token was incorrect or expired

code.description: Error code. It was designed to be unique for each place where an error can occur

get.summary: Get your current roles on selected instance
get.description: That handler is used by proxy to check access to multi instance services when request contains token

parameters.name: X-XSRF-Token
parameters.description: Token that was got

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: Existing instance ID. Minimal value - 1.

owner_id.description: Authorized owner. That value will be used to check access for this session.

trustee_id.description: Authorized user. It contains ID of user was used to login to system. owner_id and trustee_id pair identifies list of current session roles. If owner and trustee is a same user this property can be omitted

roles.description: Current users roles. If it is null - no handle was found (no one role was permitted to call it)

401.description: Provided token was incorrect or expired

code.description: Error code. It was designed to be unique for each place where an error can occur

get.summary: Get your current session information
get.description: That handler is used to check user session

parameters.name: X-XSRF-Token
parameters.description: Token that was got

owner_id.description: Authorized owner. That value will be used to check access for this session.

owner_email.description: Authorized owner email. That value will be used to check access for this session.

trustee_id.description: Authorized user. It contains ID of user was used to login to system. owner_id and trustee_id pair identifies list of current session roles. If owner and trustee is a same user this property can be omitted

trustee_email.description: Authorized user email. It contains email of user was used to login to system.

roles.description: Current user (owner) roles

401.description: Provided token was incorrect or expired

code.description: Error code. It was designed to be unique for each place where an error can occur

post.summary: Create new user/administrator in selected instance
post.description: Register new user in the system and grant access to selected instance. For internal use only. Using simple '/user' handle is more properly way to do it. '/user' handle must be imroved to accept crypted passwords.

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: Existing instance ID. Minimal value - 1.

email.description: User E-Mail will be used as login name

encrypted_password.description: It must be an encrypted string. We save it as is.

roles.description: Set of the roles for "src" service

task.description: Task id. Most objects are not created immedeatly. In most cases when you recieve result only record in database was created. To finish object creation system will create 'task'. Only when task will be finished object will be ready. You can wait task using its Id or watching for object itself (it is prefered way). For details you should read Notifier documentation

get.summary: Get roles of selected user/trustee pair in selected instance
get.description: That handler is used by proxy to check access to multi instance services when request doesn't contain token but has Internal-Auth header

parameters.name: instance_id
parameters.description: Existing instance ID. Minimal value - 1.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: You can use user Id or user E-Mail

parameters.name: trustee_id
parameters.description: Trustee - user who was granted with additiobal access by some other user. Trustee always used with user_id (so called owner id). That value will be used to check objects owner if needed. As in `UserId` you can use user Id or user E-Mail for this value.

owner_id.description: Authorized owner. That value will be used to check access for this session.

trustee_id.description: Authorized user. It contains ID of user was used to login to system. owner_id and trustee_id pair identifies list of current session roles. If owner and trustee is a same user this property can be omitted

roles.description: Current users roles. If it is null - no handle was found (no one role was permitted to call it)

get.summary: Get roles of selected user/trustee pair
get.description: That handler can be used by proxy to check access to single instance services when request doesn't contain token but has Internal-Auth header. But in general it never should be used (we needent to grant trustee access to single instance services because most of such services are used to manipulate personal user settings)

parameters.description: You can use user Id or user E-Mail

parameters.name: trustee_id
parameters.description: Trustee - user who was granted with additiobal access by some other user. Trustee always used with user_id (so called owner id). That value will be used to check objects owner if needed. As in `UserId` you can use user Id or user E-Mail for this value.

owner_id.description: Authorized owner. That value will be used to check access for this session.

trustee_id.description: Authorized user. It contains ID of user was used to login to system. owner_id and trustee_id pair identifies list of current session roles. If owner and trustee is a same user this property can be omitted

roles.description: Current users roles. If it is null - no handle was found (no one role was permitted to call it)

trustee_id.description: Authorized user. It contains ID of user was used to login to system. owner_id and trustee_id pair identifies list of current session roles. If owner and trustee is a same user this property can be omitted

roles.description: Current users roles. If it is null - no handle was found (no one role was permitted to call it)

401.description: Provided token was incorrect or expired

code.description: Error code. It was designed to be unique for each place where an error can occur

get.summary: Get roles of selected user/trustee pair
get.description: That handler can be used by proxy to check access to single instance services when request doesn't contain token but has Internal-Auth header. But in general it never should be used (we needent to grant trustee access to single instance services because most of such services are used to manipulate personal user settings)

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: You can use user Id or user E-Mail

parameters.name: trustee_id
parameters.description: Trustee - user who was granted with additiobal access by some other user. Trustee always used with user_id (so called owner id). That value will be used to check objects owner if needed. As in `UserId` you can use user Id or user E-Mail for this value.

roles.description: Current users roles. If it is null - no handle was found (no one role was permitted to call it)

attempts_counting_duration.description: Which time in seconds, unseccessful attempts will be counted.

uuid.description: Unique user Id. It should be used for all external links

email.description: User E-Mail. It is also used as login name

roles.description: User roles for 'src' service

Internal.name: Internal-Auth
Internal.description: Internal-Auth header should contain complete response body from `/whoami` handler. If service recieve such header in request it does not check cookie. No one request coming from outside can contain Internal-Auth header even if it does header will be removed by incoming proxy service. Also this header can have value 'on' means that it is internal system request with `@internal` role access

UserId.name: user_id
UserId.description: You can use user Id or user E-Mail

AclId.name: acl_id
AclId.description: You can use ACL Id or ACL name

TrusteeId.name: trustee_id
TrusteeId.description: Trustee - user who was granted with additiobal access by some other user. Trustee always used with user_id (so called owner id). That value will be used to check objects owner if needed. As in `UserId` you can use user Id or user E-Mail for this value.

ConfirmationId.name: confirmation_id
ConfirmationId.description: Confirmation token for the password restoration

ListFilter.name: filter
ListFilter.description: List field name. Gets set of unique field values. This parameter used to get values for select input in filtering forms. Filtering, pagination and order parameters will be ignored

ListWhere.name: where
ListWhere.description: Filtering rules for the list. You can use any list field name and set of logical operations (OR, AND, NOT, EQ(=), NE(<>), GT(>), GE(>=), LT(<), LE(<=) and CP(LIKE)) for making filtering conditions
ListWhere.example: id GT 100 AND (name CP 'alex%' OR name CP 'georg')

ListOrderBy.name: orderby
ListOrderBy.description: Sorting rules for the list. You can use any list field name and optional ordering parameter (`ASC` and `DESC`). `ASK` is the default so you needent to specify it

ListLimit.name: limit
ListLimit.description: Limit row count in result. It consists from one or two parts separeted by ','. First (optional) - offset, sets first row number to return (counting from 1). Second - size, set maximum row count in result

ListAction.name: action
ListAction.description: You can save your query params `orderby` and `where` or you can use saved one

tags.name: Proxy
tags.description: set of handles disigned for proxy to check request credentials

tags.name: Key
tags.description: keys that can be used once to get authentication token

tags.name: 2FA
tags.description: set of handles to setup and use two factot authentication
